Class Cell

java.lang.Object
Cell
public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
This is for the Individual Cells of the Minesweeper Game.
Since:
1.0

    Cell()
    Constructor for The Cells.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell()
      Constructor for The Cells. Gives them their Starting state.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main Program, for testing stuffs.
      Parameters:
      args - args args args

    • ChangeCellState

      public void ChangeCellState​(java.lang.String state)
      Changes the State of this Cell.
      Parameters:
      state - What is the new State of This Cell going to be?

    • changeVisibleState

      public void changeVisibleState​(int event, boolean Recursion)
      Flips Cells to Show what is underneath them
      Parameters:
      event - Check if Cell is Being Selected or being Flagged. Left Click or Right Click
      Recursion - Makes sure that Recursive Runs of this don't do certain actions.

    • addSurroundingCell

      public void addSurroundingCell​(Cell[][] board, int x, int y)
      Adds Surrounding Cells to the Attribute Surroundings

      Adds Surrounding Cells to the Attribute Surroundings while also checking that a none existent Cell isn't accidentally added or something not possible like that.

      Parameters:
      board - Game Board for Current Minesweeper Round
      x - x Coordinate on Board
      y - y Coordinate on Board

    • getState

      public java.lang.String getState()
      This fetches the State of the Cell
      Returns:
      returns state of the Cell

    • getMine

      public boolean getMine()
      This fetches the boolean for if this Cell is a Mine or Not
      Returns:
      returns true if Cell is a Mine and false if not

    • getVisibleState

      public java.lang.String getVisibleState()
      This fetches the Visual State of the Cell
      Returns:
      returns Visual State of the Cell

    • flipCell

      public void flipCell()
      This flips the Cell should it not already be flipped

    • getFlippedState

      public boolean getFlippedState()
      This fetches the State of the Cell
      Returns:
      returns true if Cell is Flipped and false if Not Flipped.
